page.title: 15CLEVEDON PUMPING STATION
page.content: {Clevedon pumping station,}situated at the mouth of the {Blind Yeo River in {the West End of Clevedon}deals with sewage and floods.It pumps 1,320,000 gallons of water a day. The sewage and polluted water is pumped to{Kingston {Seymour sewage plant.}At the pumping station there is a big metal flap to stop the salt water from the sea getting into the river. In 1936 there were floods in Clevedon which damaged a lot of houses.Sea water flooded Westbourne Avenue, Pizey Avenue,Strode Road,Old Church Road and Lower Knowles Road. The council decided to build the sea wall higher and make it stronger. There were more bad floods in 1982 and more was added to the defences so that todey the sea wall stands at about 2 metres.
